Blog.post: To be Frank I am ashamed of the dreams I had last night. Not only were they not original but they took place in my old house. I feel that when things happen in my neighboorhood my mind is too tired to create soemthing new. Also I awoke several times knowing I had not been dreaming. In the First dream I was mearly yelling out my feelings to family then running in the direction I normally run. The only things I was happy about was one: that I realized I always run that direction and I turned around. Two: that I realized I was dreaming when I was asleep and Three: That when I was not dreaming I was just in a black nothing and I wanted to dream so bad that I forced myself awake. I hope I can put more control into my dreams. One problem is that school is coming soon and I do not know how I will record my dreams and also I wonder how school will affect my sleep. Pardon my Rants on stupid subjects. Till then Marie Sinclair

Finished Number 44 but Mark Twain. It makes you think In the wonderful way. It reminded me when I was younger and was completely serious when I thought maybe no one else has any thought. Maybe It's just me and everyone else is just in my imaginations. I was convinced until someone just said I had an overactive imagination. Then I gave up. 44 makes you think that again. That maybe this is just a single thought. Or maybe this is just a single person in the middle of no where. Thinking it all up. That we cannot feel that this is a dream because we have never woken up. Then I think of the quote 'Are you dreamwaking through reality or wake walking through dreams?' Are the dreams we are having truer than what we really see now? Like someone said to me 'You go to bed in the evening and you think you don't exist so you go to sleep. Then you wake up in the morning and the first think you think of is something completely noncoherent with your last thought, but it is a thought none the less so now you are back. You may not have existed last night But now you think so you exist now.' Then there's the other theory which I am not sure whether to dive into or watch from the side pondering the faults and flaws. The theory which is simply if you believe in something it becomes so.' that's saying that if you hope for something to happen your letting it happen that if you believe something can happen that is enough power to make it happen and if you doubt something that power is negative and it causes that to happen. Its not whether or not someone is going to pick your name or whether someone is going to hurt another person. It's just the power of the wish. As far fetched as these may seem. It seems closer than the idea of someone sitting on a cloud watching everyone and anyone at the exact moment and being able to grant wishes only if you are good to them. It seems that most people who believe in god choose not to believe in him but choose to believe that when you die you won't just not exist anymore. It seems that that thought is too hard for some minds to compehend and so they make up ideas that make them seem better and make them believe that once they die they are going to keep everything just the way they please. Forgive me for ranting. But that's just how my mind works when it reads this book. It's wonderful. Twisting minds and everything. Till then Marie Sinclair
It'll be a great day when stores sell matching wedding dresses and when theres a discount on belly to cartilage chains at Helzbergs.
urlLink border=0>

Now that I have started recording dreams I start to recognize places. Like The most common A beach city. In the south is a rainy swamp that's an olive green. It has no sign of life anywhere. If you walk far enough it will be grassy and flat. To the northeast is a boardwalk. It's never sunny there. Somewhat rainy and dull. On the board walk is a lot of shops. One is a building that is the size of two classrooms. Shelves are lined with small moose on the top. There's a rack for sunglasses. It's always full. Further north is the beach it has small kiosks on the high sand. Colorful kiosks. The beach is plain. But something important. You can never feel the temperature there. This is someplace new. Then there's the dock just a dock wooden with a dojo behind it water lines it 3 docks go out of the main boardwalk the middle one has a broken plank that I have fallen in before. From underneath you can see the people above it. I have not used it in a while. Then there's places that I have been in real life. I hope by harnessing where I am I can control my sleeping body as well as my waking. Last night was the closest I have come. I convinced myself I was dreaming and proved it. But then I awoke. I wonder if that is because it was morning or because I knew it was not real.

Dream One: Walking home on the side of the road He pulls up I can't tell who is who I get in He drives me home We pass the cemetery We stop We get out I ring the buzzer Door opens He follows I walk forward He follows I ask what he is doing He says he is walking me home Horn Honks Dream Two: I'm at a beach house He is there with someone else They are walking on edge of river I walk behind carrying cat He doesn't notice I let cat down to run home She runs out into water Then runs into forest He smiles And helps me We walk into forest He pretends he found it It is an Easter egg full of grass I walk away bemused I see kittens I grab blue ones Hand them to him Walk further litter litters river bed I bend to pick up and grab another kitten I find cat but it turns around a bend . Dream 3. Familiar landscape Beach I have been here in other dreams I walk to friend 'Want to go swimming?'says I 'I just went. But I will go again' says he I grab phone and keys And jump out the window on my bike again I recognize this landscape I swerve past cars and end at a beach that was the short way I rush forward and pick up a pink stone in the shape of a cat I show it to my friend He bites it I smile I dive under Then I realize I am not wet. I am dreaming. This is a dream And I woke up.

Dream: Last night my dreams were abler Strange things that seemded so real. A friend quoting song lyrics to a man I think she loved him she said to him: I've got a short skirt and a looonnng jacket. I remember cooking for myself but not knowing what to make and finally deciding on clam chowder. oh it was such a blur of things. I will have to remember soon. there was something urgent in it. that I cannot remember. ♣♣♣♣♣♣♣♣♣♣♣♣♣♣♣♣♣♣♣♣♣♣♣♣ Andy Kaufman is a debate I cannot help but be interested in. surely he couldn't be alive after all these years? It's like claiming Kurt Cobain was walking down the streets of Chicago. While its easy to call yourself someone in real life if you look alike It's even easier to call yourself someone online. Where no one can see you. I vote that Andy Kaufman is still dead and will remain so until the end of time. Thank You ×××× Marie

Last night. In dreamland or wake land. .. . I was walking with a friend. Someone I once loved. And we sat down. There were people coming. Famour politions that I didn't know. He was sitting next to me I shivered. One woman came up to me and said her name I gasped. It was her. Her next to me next to him next to me She passed me a note and walked away. 'Don't worry. I can see it in the way he sits. He love's you more than you think.' I smiled. We walked to a home. It must have been my family house out of town. I walked around and went to a small room. Then the bedroom. We were giddy with sssssecrecy. I knew my cousin was gone She had school. Her room was gorgerous. Bright Hallway. A Bright Hallway With a bad on the side of the wall. She was there. OH. we were so so ever so Giddy. In the opposite I walked to class where I see him He wasn't there..
euphoria

arrow: Noun 1. A missile having a straight thin shaft with a pointed head at one end and often flight-stabilizing vanes at the other, meant to be shot from a bow. 2. Something, such as a directional symbol, that is similar to an arrow in form or function. Intransitive verb Inflected forms: arrowed, arrow·ing, arrows To move like an arrow. Etymology Middle English arwe, from Old English. Verb Inflected forms: point·ed, point·ing, points Verb tr. 1. To direct or aim: point a weapon. See Synonyms at aim. 2. To bring (something) to notice: pointed out an error in their reasoning. 3. To indicate the position or direction of: pointed out the oldest buildings on the skyline. 4. To sharpen (a pencil, for example); provide with a point. 5. To separate with decimal points: pointing off the hundredths place in a column of figures. 6. To mark (text) with points; punctuate. 7. Linguistics To mark (a consonant) with a vowel point. 8. To give emphasis to; stress: comments that simply point up flawed reasoning. 9. To indicate the presence and position of (game) by standing immobile and directing the muzzle toward it. Used of a hunting dog. 10. To fill and finish the joints of (masonry) with cement or mortar. Verb intr. 1. To direct attention or indicate position with or as if with the finger. 2. To turn the mind or thought in a particular direction or to a particular conclusion: All indications point to an early spring. 3. To be turned or faced in a given direction; aim. 4. To indicate the presence and position of game. Used of a hunting dog. 5. Nautical To sail close to the wind. I never under estimate an arrow. all it is is a shape. But people rely so heavily on it. you can't even imagine the corner of the page that says back forward more options this way that way wrong right go here stop now

Last night I had a dream that I was walking down the long street. I had seen it before. I know I have. It was like a path I had taken before. Only Mirror Image. And I found a building full of things I would never by but spend hours thinking about. And I saw friends. And I saw him. The guy everyone dreams about. In my dream. was the guy I was always afraid of. We talked. And Walked. And then more friends. But when everyone walked away I knew something was amiss They walked on a boat And I followed It was a place I knew I had been A few years ago. A river or steam filled with lily pads and the sides were rice plants. In the middle of the path was a clear area. r i v e r l m l c l m l l u l l l u l l d l e l d l l d l a l d l l y l n l y l l l l l That I longed to swim in. So I said so. He nodded. Then I saw what everything else and i took it back he nodded and we went on the boat to the sun rise. ××××× When I awoke I saw him that day I glanced at him He glanced away .

My Dream Nothing Can describe Nothing-ness Like a chackboard erase d after a school day Nothing But A Hallway With a door The Door is made of wood I already know its smooth Like a desk of silver or something else made of plastic I don't know what was there But people Standing there pointed to the door Follow the arrows Follow them Marie If you go there we'll all be equals and we'll all be friends forever So I did But the door Stayed exactly where it was I walked And I stayted I walked And It moved >..

My eyes, are they red? Like I've been crying? Or standing over a fire of old photographs? Beg pardon but is my voice cracking? Like I've been screaming? Or singing the lonely night love song? Someone once told me the best time to fly away is when its raining cos no one seems to look up when its pouring in their face. And I told them if I were to fly away no one would see me b/c I'd fly away to find them Someone once told me the best time to run away is when someone has just returned cos people seem not to care about anybody else when someone that has been gone suddenly returns. And I told them if I were to run away no one would notice me. Someone once told me the if I were to take a picture do it when nothings happening cos things seem to happen when you least expect them And then I told them if you expect something to happen when you least expect it to its better off to just take the picture when you don't expect anything. Someone once told me that if I were to fall in love do it with someone whos already in love. cos that way you'll never have to remember that he once love d you. And then I told them if I ever fell in love that person would never even know my name Someone once told me that if I broke someone's heart be sure to do it to someone's whos heart has already been broken. Cos that way no one new would have to suffer the shattering of their soul And then I told him that if I ever broke someone's heart I'd be breaking my own Someone once told me if I learned the number of seconds before the lightning struck I'd know everything Cos everyone knows something and lightning is everyone And I told them that I already knew everything that I could learn. Someone once told me that if I knew everything I should just go crazy. Cos there would be nothing for me to miss. And I told him I planned to do exactly that .

lets begin again shall we? something we wont forget. I had a dream last night. I was in a park with a family I had never seen before, I was walking to somewhere even though I knew it was a circle. And While I walked I saw these beasts but even though I was alone nothing happen. But I ran anyways. Fast. In a circle. Then I was walking with family. Then I was walking with a cousin. Then I was walking with a dog. Then I was alone In a circle just around and around and around But suddenly there was something new. It was a ... museum? or an art show. Filled with childs things. Everything was so real and strange and childlike And I walked ahead looking at the lights and tile. I saw the mother of the family I didn't know. And suddenly I was running from her. Everything I did had to be far away from her. So i ran. And I knew she followed. And When I awoke the next morning. I forgot all about it. I was thinking. Later on earlier in the week. About this: Here we have a world where we use insults that would never be said years ago. But years before those years ago they were simple things to say. And when we look at those people we think of them as so filled with hate and so evil. But when we compare the two together..we say we say it. but dont mean it. So how can we say something we don't mean then riddicule others when they do the same? × × × × Somethings I noticed while doing nothing. Today we make millions of films. Today Yesterday tomorrow and the day after. Horror History SciFi Porn Humour Musicals Noir .. ect. But with so many movies not all of them can be watched. So we al know a select few are watched and a even fewer amount is noticed. But the most sucessful ones of the ones watched aren't about the furute or the day before it or even the present. They are from way back when everything waas simple and handwashed. So if the world wants to see the past. Why don't we stop .. making the future? or Why don't we stop ruining the present?

Dream I was in some sort of a contest If you did all the things that he asked you to You woulnd't have to drink the blood. I drank it anyways And While I drank baking oil poured over my head I tried to ignore it Someone told me to wash it out It could be dangerous I washed it out but told them it wasn't because of them I saw friends on the other side of the glass I waved and hugged them I said goodbye and walked

Some cat lady took my cat And another She yelled about me not having the right cat I cried that she was wrong This was my cat it had the same markings I was sorry I had labled them wrong I threw them into the car And at the end Were credits I watched it once Then rewound it back and I watched it half way till I turned it off

Don't ask me, I can't remember. Standing Here In Some Conversation He doesn't want to be here She doesn't want to go What a Strange life to live I can't imagine what pills I would have to take to Dream this They used to love each other But now they have to hide Everyone can see just what they mean To Do But everyone is kinder here And everyone won't talk about it Till They've left the room Panic Attacks All Around Hide them behind your eyes And see how long it has to be before you scream This seems like someone I knew Then I realize I'm still talking to them I nod and walk away Twisted Organs wrap around my neck Even if I wanted to be free.. You've tied these knots too tight Knowing what was to come Would have ruined this I'm standing on a wooden plank Dizzy in the breeze I was watching you while you slept Your breathe was steady Your eyes were darting underneath your lids That was until I drove my knife into your knee I hope when you woke up You knew it was from me I'm too tired to tell the whole story And what was your name again? I didn't here it quite clearly Something about your broken neck might have slurred things I'm sorry I have to go But I trust our dinner date for Thursday is still in effect.

Dream It was so clear when I didn't have time to write it down. I remember Children Took a dog and put it in a hole. Then buried it under cement They claimed he was hurting them I cried The puppies just laid there I revealed A secret that wasn't true They said they were sorry but shrugged it off There was a contest blurred.. I didnt want to complete in it. Someone scolded me.. Blurred

Away. For a bit. spent a lot of time thinking. don't remember most of it One topic: The woman stereotype. How did it begin? In the cavemen times stereotypes couldn't really have started . Cos if women started off then doing certain tasks we can't really blame the men. and by acting different then the men and trying to get our rights but still separating ourselves we are separating ourselves while trying to put us together.

I am sorry I have forgotten or more to the point I have forced it out of my head I'm so unsure of how to avoid this conversation I recognize the start of the words I see you practicing the speech you planned out in your head But I know we'll both work to avoid this conversation Things just aren't as before In more ways than one I'm sure you've felt this way more than once But for now I don't want to hear Your lame attempts of putting me behind you This isn't a love song This never was a tragedy Just because you hid it behind you and use it as a secret weapon The bleeding won't stop and I'm afraid to show you In case you'll turn away I write these letters Like your speechs Some day I'll think of them But for now I'll simply regret starting this trend in your eyes
I wonder. Knowing what lies I tell others. I wonder what lies I am being told.

In a sudden burst I ignorance the phone and awaiting arguments and scratched down words I hoped I would find later on. I did Notes: if someone where to go into the past from the future to change the present the present would be changed thus if this happened we wouldn't know we would have to e future had already happened the past would change and new versions of ourselves would be made. thus if the past were changed we would never know if we did something to start over start over all over again. as foolish as it sounds... this is the first time I have realized this...

I've been biting my finger. Hoping no ones seen me. I've been hiding my face Hoping no one recognizes me. I feel ..twisted. I feel like two different people. I supposed everyone feels like that. But It's driving me insane . OH man OH man. How I wish I could act normal. But normal for them isn't normal for me. Twisted. Dreams: All I can remember is standing at the bathroom mirror wishing I had lipstick and a dark room with 6-7 beds. The Third from the left was unfolded. And something strange happened. I remember the thoughts that I had. 'I hope no one had sex in these beds. Because then I'd have to sleep on the floor.' I have no idea why that bothered me so much? Thoughts: I wish that the person I marry could have met my younger self. In his current state. Because I find that children seem to see what adults cannot. they see the flaws that no one else but children could see.
I touch the fire, and it freezes me I died I look into it... So many years ago And it's black This isn't real You can make me... But I just wanna feel Feel And where do we all Go from here?

I touch the fire, and it freezes me I look into it, and it's black Why can't I feel? My skin should crack and peel I want the fire back Now, through the smoke, she calls to me To make my way across the flame To save the day Or maybe melt away I guess it's all the same So I will Walk through the fire 'Cause where else can I turn? I will Walk through the fire And let it... The torch I bear is scorching me Drawn to the fire Some people... She will never learn And she will Walk through the fire and let it... Walk through the fire So one by one, they turn from me I guess my friends can't face the cold What can't we face? But why I froze, Not one among them knows And never can be told She came from the grave much graver One by one, they come to me First, he’ll kill her, then I’ll save her Everything is turning out so dark Going through the motions What's it going to take to strike a spark? It's what they have inside She will come These endless days Are finally ending in a blaze And we are Caught in the fire The point of no return So we will Walk through the fire And let it burn Let it burn Let it burn And let it burn!

I died So many years ago You can make me feel Like it isn't so And why you come to be with me I think I finally know mmm-mmm You're scared Ashamed of what you feel And you can't tell the ones you love You know they couldn't deal Whisper in a dead man's ear It doesn't make it real That's great But I don't wanna play 'Cause being with you touches me More than I can say And since I’m only dead to you I’m saying stay away and Let me rest in peace Let me rest in peace Let me get some sleep Let me take my love and bury it In a hole 6-foot deep I can lay my body down But I can't find my, sweet release So let me rest in peace You know, You got a willing slave You just love to play the thought That you might misbehave Till you do, I'm telling you Stop visiting my grave Let me rest in peace I know I should go But I follow you like a man possessed There's a traitor here beneath my breast And it hurts me more than you've ever guessed If my heart could beat, it would break my chest but I can see you're unimpressed So leave me be and Let me rest in peace Let me get some sleep Let me take my love and bury it Im a hole 6-foot deep I can lay my body down But I can't find my sweet release Let me rest in peace Why won't you Let me rest in peace?

Everytime I draw the curves of your faces My hand starts to shake and my mind is lost in haze I've stolen and betrayed everyone I knew Back in the Day when fishes used to sing Whenever I see that face of yours at that angle that it has I get a flash and see just what it was that I did Back in the Day when tongues were sliced just like heads I've been faced with a situation like this before I have to bit my cheek just so I won't blurt out the answers You told me we were going looking But then it ended and we had to go But don't you start crying I'll sing you to sleep A lullaby of lies A Serande of somber stories A ballad of fabricated awareness Happy every holiday I'll see you next year I have to say I regret not booking my plane later But every time I see you my eyes get the jitters And I can't stay here like that
I'm still waiting for you..
July 27th, 2004 -aka- Superhero Day and/or Yellow Rubber Jacket Day

As I woke from my passing dreams of politics and science. I nudged my foot in the direction of my cat. I looked deep into it's eyes and I told it the most important thing I will ever tell anyone. "Go back to Kansas Dorthy, Just go, back to Kansas." Then I realized what I wanted. The Kansas that I was searching for was Oz. Then I lowered my head in submission and fell back to dreaming of lost innocence and babbles of soap scum. ...'I bent my head over to grab an item of importance to me and as if in a daze. I remembered something. A dream within a dream. Something that for that second felt so entirely like reality. It was something so important that I probably will never be able to remember the plot line again'... So I got to thinking, as thinking is something I pride myself in, and I thought if something that wasn't even an actual dream, just a dream within a dream. Well then could this very second you or I read this be actually an hour or a second or a second (and them some) in some other field? Sure, In our heads things seem so very real but...doesn't everything seem so very real? In a way I want to find something else to devote my attentions to but , in another way I so very much want to solve this puzzle..to open this box of mysteries...

How oft when men are at the point of death Have they been merry! which their keepers call A lightning before death. O, how may I Call this a lightning? O my love! my wife! Death, that hath suck'd the honey of thy breath, Hath had no power yet upon thy beauty. Thou art not conquer'd. Beauty's ensign yet Is crimson in thy lips and in thy cheeks, And death's pale flag is not advanced there. Tybalt, liest thou there in thy bloody sheet? O, what more favour can I do to thee Than with that hand that cut thy youth in twain To sunder his that was thine enemy? Forgive me, cousin.' Ah, dear Juliet, Why art thou yet so fair? Shall I believe That unsubstantial Death is amorous, And that the lean abhorred monster keeps Thee here in dark to be his paramour? For fear of that I still will stay with thee And never from this palace of dim night Depart again. Here, here will I remain With worms that are thy chambermaids. O, here Will I set up my everlasting rest And shake the yoke of inauspicious stars From this world-wearied flesh. Eyes, look your last! Arms, take your last embrace! and, lips, O you The doors of breath, seal with a righteous kiss A dateless bargain to engrossing death! Come, bitter conduct; come, unsavoury guide! Thou desperate pilot, now at once run on The dashing rocks thy seasick weary bark! Here's to my love! O true apothecary! Thy drugs are quick. Thus with a kiss I die. What's here? A cup, clos'd in my true love's hand? Poison, I see, hath been his timeless end. O churl! drunk all, and left no friendly drop To help me after? I will kiss thy lips. Haply some poison yet doth hang on them To make me die with a restorative. [Kisses him.] Thy lips are warm! Yea, noise? Then I'll be brief. O happy dagger! This is thy sheath; there rest, and let me die. She stabs herself and falls [on Romeo's body]. This is the place. There, where the torch doth burn. 'the ground is bloody. Search about the churchyard. Go, some of you; whoe'er you find attach. Pitiful sight! here lies the County slain; And Juliet bleeding, warm, and newly dead, Who here hath lain this two days buried. Go, tell the Prince; run to the Capulets; Raise up the Montagues; some others search. We see the ground whereon these woes do lie, But the true ground of all these piteous woes We cannot without circumstance descry. Cap. What should it be, that they so shriek abroad? Wife. The people in the street cry 'Romeo,' Some 'Juliet,' and some 'Paris'; and all run, With open outcry, toward our monument. Prince. What fear is this which startles in our ears? Chief Watch. Sovereign, here lies the County Paris slain; And Romeo dead; and Juliet, dead before, Warm and new kill'd. Prince. Search, seek, and know how this foul murder comes. Chief Watch. Here is a friar, and slaughter'd Romeo's man, With instruments upon them fit to open These dead men's tombs. Cap. O heavens! O wife, look how our daughter bleeds! This dagger hath mista'en, for, lo, his house Is empty on the back of Montague, And it missheathed in my daughter's bosom! Wife. O me! this sight of death is as a bell Prince. Seal up the mouth of outrage for a while, Till we can clear these ambiguities And know their spring, their head, their true descent; And then will I be general of your woes And lead you even to death. Meantime forbear, And let mischance be slave to patience. Bring forth the parties of suspicion. Friar. I am the greatest, able to do least, Yet most suspected, as the time and place Doth make against me, of this direful murther; And here I stand, both to impeach and purge Myself condemned and myself excus'd. Prince. Then say it once what thou dost know in this. Friar. I will be brief, for my short date of breath Is not so long as is a tedious tale. Romeo, there dead, was husband to that Juliet; And she, there dead, that Romeo's faithful wife. I married them; and their stol'n marriage day Was Tybalt's doomsday, whose untimely death Banish'd the new-made bridegroom from this city; For whom, and not for Tybalt, Juliet pin'd. You, to remove that siege of grief from her, Betroth'd and would have married her perforce To County Paris. Then comes she to me And with wild looks bid me devise some mean To rid her from this second marriage, Or in my cell there would she kill herself. Then gave I her (so tutored by my art) A sleeping potion; which so took effect As I intended, for it wrought on her The form of death. Meantime I writ to Romeo That he should hither come as this dire night To help to take her from her borrowed grave, Being the time the potion's force should cease. But he which bore my letter, Friar John, Was stay'd by accident, and yesternight Return'd my letter back. Then all alone At the prefixed hour of her waking Came I to take her from her kindred's vault; Meaning to keep her closely at my cell Till I conveniently could send to Romeo. But when I came, some minute ere the time Of her awaking, here untimely lay The noble Paris and true Romeo dead. She wakes; and I entreated her come forth And bear this work of heaven with patience; But then a noise did scare me from the tomb, And she, too desperate, would not go with me, But, as it seems, did violence on herself. All this I know, and to the marriage Her nurse is privy; and if aught in this Miscarried by my fault, let my old life Be sacrific'd, some hour before his time, Unto the rigour of severest law. Prince. This letter doth make good the friar's words, Their course of love, the tidings of her death; And here he writes that he did buy a poison Of a poor pothecary, and therewithal Came to this vault to die, and lie with Juliet. Where be these enemies? Capulet, Montage, See what a scourge is laid upon your hate, That heaven finds means to kill your joys with love! And I, for winking at you, discords too, Have lost a brace of kinsmen. All are punish'd. Cap. O brother Montague, give me thy hand. This is my daughter's jointure, for no more Can I demand. Mon. But I can give thee more; For I will raise her Statue in pure gold, That whiles Verona by that name is known, There shall no figure at such rate be set As that of true and faithful Juliet. Cap. As rich shall Romeo's by his lady's lie- Poor sacrifices of our enmity! Prince. A glooming peace this morning with it brings. The sun for sorrow will not show his head. Go hence, to have more talk of these sad things; Some shall be pardon'd, and some punished; For never was a story of more woe Than this of Juliet and her Romeo. Exeunt omnes.
Part One , Act One

The world was going to cave in Mud was flowing in from all sides But I headed far There was evacuation Through the cool blue water And yellow kayaks I ran away and jumped down the path but I took the wrong one And I ended up in an office I went crazy seeing myself in a new angle grabbed everything but a boat. I flew down the slide and grabbed a paper plate and watched as I floated in a circle and the others floated away.

How dare he do that What does he think he is Everyone avoided me. I swtepped out onto the stage and followed the simply ways. Left. Right. Right. Backwards. Right Right. Backwards. Left. ××××××××××× Till then

I knew this place. I had come here before ..Walking. I stopped at a store I had seen before. The necklace was sold out. OH well.. I turned, A military building was burning, to the ground. I ran when I heard the yelling. The Plays, the plays are burning. I was interested. I ran to it but found, to my dismay, that it was not really them. In the smoking ruins someone I knew stood. upset We volunteered to help. We scavened through boxes. Laughed at images. Then we sat and ate. I pulled a yellow cake with chocolate chips marked under the colum suicide and coconut macaroons from despair. The silver tray spun, but I turned and sat back down. I worried no one would know I was not dead. Oh well. I walked out the door

I had memories already A life Planned out I had recently arrived from a trip but I was going back again. I started packing my bags but then I discovered I had left battereies behind I'd pick them up at the airport. People lived at the airport and I talked to friends and saw people I knew. It was like a class I put my bags down in the 17th aisle of an auditorium. And Walked away. <><> <> I was on the moon floating Watching so I would not be seen I ran down an aisle until a friend fell We yelled at him Get up Get up Get up Get up Then I did ><><> Theres more but I feel like I should not reveal it for now.

Segments of my dreams for the past week or so I. Its a park or museum I'm walking around looking at all of the exhibits I vaguely see people I vaguely know We walk through a long glass tunnel With animals and plants on both sides When I finish walking I realize I have forgotten something I grab someone I know and turn back to get it People look at and begin to tell me something when. II. A song I have never heard before Someone I have never talked to singing it III. I am with someone I do not trust Phone Rings I answer woman's Voice She obviously has mistaken me for someone else I listen anyways Shocked I hang up And run to my companion I yell and shout things I have kept inside of me But no matter how much I yell I have this tingly feeling that means I'm scared. III. I was walking with the same person But I doubt anything had happened A helicopter flew by and I mentioned how low it was I saw it further away landing I ran I container was holding children Everyone Gasped The container opened Everyone Spoke of the child inside Everyone smiled and clapped as the children moved The middle child turned around and cried out I can't see Everyone gasped The couple next to me started crying that was their children They were my family I knew them They knew me We told them to come to my house The oldest was fine The younger boy and girl were blind They tried doing things but It couldn't work They were scared and humiliated IV. I Was in a camp where everyone acted as if they were from a different era I was happy I acted different There was one boy that led me He worked the garden I threw seeds into the field The family praised him Then a heavy downpour started It flew into the house We were all struggling I threw open the remote control and stopped the rain from coming in we ran to the boy He was alright Someone came to pick me up We explained it to him The boy acted normal But there was still a mysterious haze around him That I wanted to know what it was We all confided secrets and weaknesses It lasted all day.' That was only a small part of it
